dt: {bc}marked by harmony, regularity, or steady continuity {bc}free from variation or contradiction
{bc}showing steady conformity to character, {d_link|profession|profession}, belief, or custom
{bc}tending to be arbitrarily close to the true value of the parameter estimated as the sample becomes large

quotes.t: One of the strengths of Blake's letters is their {qword}consistent{/qword} readability …

I am not {qword}consistent{/qword} about giving vibrancy and other kinds of input to a relationship.  … There are periods when I am the most attentive and thoughtful lover in the world, and periods, too, when I am just unavailable.

subsource.source: in {it}The Story and Its Writer{/it}, edited by Ann Charters

quotes.t: The rhythm of the gesture never varied. The paper flew in identically the same arc at each doorway, landed in identically the same spot. It was impossible for anybody to throw with such {qword}consistent{/qword} perfection.
… the sixty-five-year-old filmmaker continues to practice his craft with {qword}consistent{/qword} artistic aplomb.

et: borrowed from Latin {it}consistent-, consistens,{/it} present participle of {it}consistere{/it} "to come to a halt, remain at the same level, take up a position, reside, be composed of, be established (in a given state)" {ma}{mat|consist:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: marked by harmony, regularity, or steady continuity : free from variation or contradiction
marked by agreement : compatible —usually used with with
showing steady conformity to character, profession, belief, or custom
